Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Hydroxyethyl Starch vs. Albumin in Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: single-centre, triple-blinded, parallel-group, randomised, non-inferiority trial

Participants.evidence: patients aged 40–85 scheduled for elective aortic valve replacement, with or without coronary artery bypass grafting

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 to receive 6% HES 130/0.4 or 5% human albumin.

Objective.evidence: We aimed to assess whether intra-operative HES administration affects postoperative kidney function and haemostasis compared to human albumin.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was urinary neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin (NGAL) concentrations measured at baseline, 1 hour, and 24 hours post-surgery.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was done using a secure web-based system, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: between June 2015 and February 2018. Participants were randomised 1:1

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 141 patients were analysed (69 HES, 72 albumin).

Result_Outcome.evidence: Postoperative NGAL was slightly lower with HES (median 5 ng/ml) vs. albumin (median 5 ng/ml), but not non-inferior [ratio of geometric means 0.91, 95% CI 0.57 to 1.44; p = 0.15].

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.
